thread.title: Week ahead: US jobs data and ECB policy meeting on the horizon
thread.title_full: Week ahead: US jobs data and ECB policy meeting on the horizon

title: Week ahead: US jobs data and ECB policy meeting on the horizon
text:
402.50 0.00 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - All eyes will be on the latest US jobs data in the coming week. While the monthly US employment reports are always of paramount importance, this time around that will be even more so the case, as they will be the last non-farm payrolls figures to be released before the Federal Reserve´s next monetary policy meeting. 
The ISM manufacturing sector purchasing managers´ index for August and the Fed´s Beige book, both of which are set for release on Tuesday and Wednesday, respectively, will also be closely watched. 
The day before, the European Central Bank will meet to decide on monetary policy. In the wake of the latest bout of volatility in global capital markets, some observers increasingly expect the ECB to add to or prolong the duration of its asset purchase programme. 
In parallel, the latest euro area consumer price data out at the start of the week, on Monday, is expected to reveal that inflation fell back to the brink of outright price declines. 
The most important data to watch out for in Britain will be Markit´s manufacturing sector PMI survey results on Tuesday and the latest net consumer credit figures.
